intro: Echium molle, commonly known as soft thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its soft, woolly leaves and spikes of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Echium molle is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental uses. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to local biodiversity.
